basics.name: Sarah Amiraslani
basics.label: Data Scientist | Quantitative Analyst | Developer Relations Specialist
basics.summary: Driven Data Science and Analytics professional with a passion for leveraging data to design creative solutions to complex problems.

work.name: Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.
work.summary: As the primary technical contributor of the AI/ML developer relations, I drove a 60% efficiency boost in model development, a 150% increase in tool adoption, and enhanced collaboration with vendors and departments. By creating tech articles, hosting office hours, and improving documentation, I fueled a 150% rise in tool adoption. Strategic coordination cut model time-to-market by 20% and generated $1M in value, elevating our program's visibility company-wide.

work.name: Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.
work.summary: A contract position for which I was converted into my full-time role as a Quantitative Analytics Specialist. As I did not change teams, my role and contributions are similar to those listed above.

work.name: Changing Room, INC.
work.summary: I led the development of data mining and ETL pipelines, creating Python programs to scrape over 100,000 fashion brand inventory items and attributes for optimized database storage, resulting in high-quality machine learning training data. Collaborating with model developers and UX engineers, I developed an AI-driven recommendation system, delivered via a Chrome plugin, to promote sustainable purchasing and ethically informed shopping.

work.name: Trackonomy Systems, INC.
work.summary: As a member of the manufacturing automation team at a startup company, I collaborated on projects to improve data collection processes and to cut production costs.
highlights: Developed an innovative computer vision system using OpenCV for pre-production quality testing, reducing material waste and alleviating production bottlenecks.
Designed and launched a Python-based GUI on Raspberry Pi devices, enhancing data collection and anomaly detection, significantly improving production efficiency and product quality.

work.name: University of California, San Diego
work.summary: Assisted in teaching introductory data science courses, provided tutoring, and helped develop course materials.

work.name: University of California, San Diego
work.summary: Conducted research on cognitive behavioral neuroscience, focusing on experimental design, data analysis, and visualization for thesis projects.

work.name: University of California, San Diego School of Medicine
work.summary: Assisted in research projects focusing on archival data analysis, data visualization, and statistical analysis.

volunteer.summary: Assisted in the distribution and packing of food for community members in need.

volunteer.organization: United Auto Workers for Academic Workers at the University of California, San Diego (UAW Local 2865)
volunteer.position: Sexual Violence and Harassment Graduate Student Representative
volunteer.summary: Advocated for graduate student workers in issues related to sexual violence and harassment, promoting reforms to the university's PhD defense procedures to reduce undue power held by faculty advisors, ensuring a safer and more equitable environment that enables students to complete their research programs.

Delivered crisis counseling and support through text communication to individuals in need. This role required extensive training in active listening, empathy, and crisis intervention techniques, resulting in meaningful support and assistance during critical moments.

education.thesis: Thesis: Developing Novel Machine Learning Algorithms for Predictive Analytics
Thesis: Drawing to Learn Abstract Science Concepts

awards.title: Norman Henry Anderson Excellence in Research Presentation
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in presenting research findings at the departmental research symposium.

awards.title: Departmental Honors
awards.summary: Received honors for outstanding academic and research performance in the department. My thesis investigated the use of drawing as a tool in STEM education to enhance the understanding of abstract concepts that lack a definitive form.

awards.title: Chancellor's Undergraduate Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Granted for exceptional undergraduate research conducted in the Psychiatry department. My thesis project explored the relationship between traumatic life experiences and disordered eating behaviors in young girls who have faced significant lifetime adversity and were incarcerated.

projects.name: Understanding the in-situ Solar Wind Properties with Machine Learning
projects.summary: Collaborated with the Climate and Space Sciences Engineering department at the University of Michigan to map solar wind in-situ properties to their origin in the sun and to better understand the differences among categories of solar wind caused by their different solar origins.
highlights: Developed data visualization tools for solar wind properties.
Analyzed large datasets to identify patterns and correlations.

projects.name: Drawing to Learn Abstract Science Concepts
projects.summary: Developed educational tools and resources to help students understand abstract scientific concepts through drawing and visualization techniques.
highlights: Conducted user testing to refine educational tools.
